classroom_inv14_152.als
>>> Starting Agent SpecificationRepairTask (2) OpenAIChatModel.GPT3_5_TURBO 
**Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person {
    /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
    Tutors: set Person,
    /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
    Teaches: set Class
}
/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}
/* The registered classes. */
sig Class {
    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
    Groups: Person -> Group
}
/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person {}
/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person {}
/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}
/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}
/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}
/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}
/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {
    all s: Student, c: Class | some t: Teacher | t -> c in Teaches
}
/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}
/* IFF PERFECT ORACLE */
pred inv14_OK {
    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}
assert inv14_Repaired {
    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}
```

**Request:** 
```json

Teaches: set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class {\n    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\n    Groups: Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\n    Person in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\n    no Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\n    no Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\n    Person in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\n    some Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\n    Teacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\n    Class in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\n    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\n    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\n    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\n    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\n    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\n    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\n ^Tutors.s\n}\n/* IFF PERFECT ORACLE */\npred inv14_OK {\n    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\n    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}"

    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s:Student,c:Class|some t:Teacher | t->c in Teaches\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\ninv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv12_OK {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\ninv12[] iff inv12_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv13_OK {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\ninv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff **Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
sig Person {
    Tutors: set Person,
    Teaches: set Class
}

sig Group {}

sig Class {
    Groups: Person -> Group
}

sig Teacher extends Person {}

sig Student extends Person {}

pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}

pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}

pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}

pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}

pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}

pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}

pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone c.Groups & Teacher
}

pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}

pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}

pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}

pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}

pred inv14 {
    all s: Student, c: Class | some s.(c.Groups) and some Teacher<:Teaches implies some (Teacher<:Tutors).s
}

pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}

pred inv14_OK {
    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}

assert inv14_Repaired {
    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}

check inv14_Repaired expect 0
```

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
sig Person {
    Tutors: set Person,
    Teaches: set Class
}

sig Group {}

sig Class {
    Groups: Person -> Group
}

sig Teacher extends Person {}

sig Student extends Person {}

pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}

pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}

pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}

pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}

pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}

pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}

pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone c.Groups & Teacher
}

pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}

pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}

pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}

pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}

pred inv14 {
    all s: Student, c: Class | some s.(c.Groups) and some Teacher<:Teaches implies some (Teacher<:Tutors).s
}

pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}

pred inv14_OK {
    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}

assert inv14_Repaired {
    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}

check inv14_Repaired expect 0
```

    Tutors: set Person,
    Teaches: set Class
}

sig Group {}

sig Class {
    Groups: Person -> Group
}

sig Teacher extends Person {}

sig Student extends Person {}

pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}

pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}

pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}

pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}

pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}

pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}

pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone c.Groups & Teacher
}

pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}

pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}

pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}

pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}

pred inv14 {
    all s: Student, c: Class | some s.(c.Groups) and some Teacher<:Teaches implies some (Teacher<:Tutors).s
}

pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}

pred inv14_OK {
    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}

assert inv14_Repaired {
    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}

check inv14_Repaired expect 0
```

```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student + Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall p : Person | some c : Class, g : Group | c->p->g in Groups and some q : Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\n\nall p : Person | some c : Class, g : Group | c->p->g in Groups and some q : Person | q->c in Teaches implies q->p in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\ninv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv12_OK {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\ninv12[] iff Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\ninv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n-\n-- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck **Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
sig Person {
    Tutors: set Person,
    Teaches: set Class
}

sig Group {}

sig Class {
    Groups: Person lone -> Group
}

sig Teacher extends Person {}

sig Student extends Person {}

pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}

pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}

pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}

pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}

pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}

pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}

pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}

pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}

pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}

pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}

pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}

pred inv14 {
    all s: Student, c: Class | some s.(c.Groups)
}

pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}

pred inv14_OK {
    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}

assert inv14_Repaired {
    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}

check inv14_Repaired expect 0
```

Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\n    Person in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Student | (some c : Class, g : Group | c->s->g  in Groups) implies some t : Teacher | t->s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n-\n-- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck Stats: N_MSG=2, TOKENS: in=1466, out=29, max=3000, ctx=16385, COST: now=$0.0015, cumul=$0.0015 (OpenAIChatModel.GPT3_5_TURBO)

To fix the syntax error in the Alloy model, you need to remove the extra space before the comment delimiter '*/' on line 185.
**Fixed Specification:**
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person  {
/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
Tutors : set Person,
/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
Teaches : set Class
}
/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}
/* The registered classes. */
sig Class  {
/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
Groups : Person -> Group
}
/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person  {}
/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person  {}
/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
Person in Student
}
/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
no Teacher
}
/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
no Student & Teacher
}
/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
some Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}
/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers
* assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {
all s:Student,c:Class|some t:Teacher | t->c in Teaches and one s.(c.Groups) and one t.(c.Groups) implies t in s.^Tutors
}
/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/
pred inv1_OK {
Person in Student
}
assert inv1_Repaired {

**Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
sig Person {
    Tutors: set Person,
    Teaches: set Class
}

sig Group {}

sig Class {
    Groups: Person lone -> Group
}

sig Teacher in Person {}

sig Student in Person {}

pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}

pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}

pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}

pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}

pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}

pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}

pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}

pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}

pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}

pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}

pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}

pred inv14 {
    all s: Student, c: Class, t: Teacher | s in c.Groups.Person and t in Teaches.c implies t in s.Tutors
}

pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}

run {}

```

```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */ sig Person { /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */ Tutors : set Person, /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */ Teaches : set Class } /* The registered groups. */ sig Group {} /* The registered classes. */ sig Class { /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */ Groups : Person -> Group } /* Some persons are teachers. */ sig Teacher extends Person {} /* Some persons are students. */ sig Student extends Person {} /* Every person is a student. */ pred inv1 { Person in Student } /* There are no teachers. */ pred inv2 { no Teacher } /* No person is both a student and a teacher. */ pred inv3 { no Student & Teacher } /* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */ pred inv4 { Person in (Student + Teacher) } /* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */ pred inv5 { some Teacher.Teaches } /* Every teacher has classes assigned. */ pred inv6 { Teacher in Teaches.Class } /* Every class has teachers assigned. */ pred inv7 { Class in Teacher.Teaches } /* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */ pred inv8 { all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches } /* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */ pred inv9 { all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher } /* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */ pred inv10 { all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups) } /* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */ pred inv11 { all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c } /* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */ pred inv12 { all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups } /* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */ pred inv13 { Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student } /* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers * assigned to that class. */ pred inv14 { all s:Student,c:Class,t:Teacher | s in c.Groups.Group } /* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */ pred inv15 { all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s }"
}

s.(c.Groups) } assert inv10_Repaired { inv10[] iff inv10_OK[] } pred inv11_OK { all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c } assert inv11_Repaired { inv11[] iff inv11_OK[] } pred inv13[] iff inv13_OK[] } pred inv14_OK { all s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors } assert inv14_Repaired { inv14[] iff inv14_OK[] } pred inv15_OK { all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s } assert inv15_Repaired { inv15[] iff inv15_OK[] } check inv1_Repaired expect 0 check inv2_Repaired expect 0 check inv3_Repaired ```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s:Student,c:Class,t:Teacher | t->c in Teaches and one s.(c.Groups) and one t.(c.Groups) implies t in s.~Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}/*======== IFF PERFECT for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in one t.(c.Groups) implies t in s.~Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\ninv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv12_OK {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\ninv12[] iff inv12_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv13_OK {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\nassert inv13_Repaired {\ninv13[] iff inv13_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv14_OK {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\ninv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n-\n-- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck {
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\n\nall s:Student,c:Class,t:Teacher | t->c in Teaches and one s.(c.Groups) and one t.(c.Groups) implies t in s.~Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}/*======== IFF PERFECT **Trial 1:**

**Faulty Specification:**
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person  {
/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
Tutors : set Person,
/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
Teaches : set Class
}
/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}
/* The registered classes. */
sig Class  {
/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
Groups : Person -> Group
}
/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person  {}
/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person  {}
/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
Person in Student
}
/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
no Teacher
}
/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
no Student & Teacher
}
/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
some Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}
/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers
* assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {

all s:Student,c:Class,g:Group|some t:Teacher | t->c in Teaches and some s.(c.Groups) and some t.(c.Groups)
}
/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/
pred inv1_OK {
Person in Student
}

{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in >>> Starting Agent SpecificationRepairTask (2) OpenAIChatModel.GPT3_5_TURBO 
**Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person {
    /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
    Tutors: set Person,
    /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
    Teaches: set Class
}
/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}
/* The registered classes. */
sig Class {
    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
    Groups: Person -> Group
}
/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person {}
/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person {}
/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}
/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}
/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}
/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}
/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers
* assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {
    all s: Student | (some c: Class, g: Group | c->s->g in Groups) implies some t: Teacher | t->s in Tutors
}
/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}
/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/
pred inv1_OK {
    Person in Student
}
assert inv1_Repaired {
    inv1[] iff inv1_OK[]
}
pred inv2_OK {
    no Teacher
}
assert inv2_Repaired {
    inv2[] iff inv2_OK[]
}
pred inv3_OK {
    no Student & Teacher
}
assert inv3_Repaired {
    inv3[] iff inv3_OK[]
}
pred inv4_OK {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
assert inv4_Repaired {
    inv4[] iff inv4_OK[]
}
pred inv5_OK {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
assert inv5_Repaired {
    inv5[] iff inv5_OK[]
}
pred inv6_OK {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
assert inv6_Repaired {
    inv6[] iff inv6_OK[]
}
pred inv7_OK {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
assert inv7_Repaired {
    inv7[] iff inv7_OK[]
}
pred inv8_OK {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
assert inv8_Repaired {
    inv8[] iff inv8_OK[]
}
pred inv9_OK {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
assert inv9_Repaired {
    inv9[] iff inv9_OK[]
}
pred inv10_OK {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
assert inv10_Repaired {
    inv10[] iff inv10_OK[]
}
pred inv11_OK {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
assert inv11_Repaired {
    inv11[] iff inv11_OK[]
}
pred inv12_OK {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}
assert inv12_Repaired {
    inv12[] iff inv12_OK[]
}
pred inv13_OK {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
assert inv13_Repaired {
    inv13[] iff inv13_OK[]
}
pred inv14_OK {
    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}
assert inv14_Repaired {
    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}
pred inv15_OK {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}
assert inv15_Repaired {
    inv15[] iff inv15_OK[]
}

The syntax error in the Alloy model can be fixed by ensuring that the correct tokens are used in line 187 column 1, such as enum, fun, let, open, or pred. Additionally, the repair process should focus on verifying and correcting the predicates and assertions 
related to the classes, teachers, students, groups, and their relationships in the model.
**Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:**
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person {
    /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
    Tutors: set Person,
    /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
    Teaches: set Class
}

/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}

/* The registered classes. */
sig Class {
    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
    Groups: Person -> Group
}

/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person {}

/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person {}

/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}

/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}

/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}

/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}

/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}

/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}

/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}

/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}

/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}

/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}

/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}

/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}

/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}

/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {
    all s: Student | (some c: Class, g: Group | c->s->g in Groups) implies some t: Teacher | t->s in Tutors
}

/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}

/* IFF Perfect Oracle */
pred inv1_OK {
    Person in Student
}
assert inv1_Repaired {
    inv1[] iff inv1_OK[]
}

pred inv2_OK {
    no Teacher
}
assert inv2_Repaired {
    inv2[] iff inv2_OK[]
}

pred inv3_OK {
    no Student & Teacher
}
assert inv3_Repaired {
    inv3[] iff inv3_OK[]
}

pred inv4_OK {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
assert inv4_Repaired {
    inv4[] iff inv4_OK[]
}

pred inv5_OK {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
assert inv5_Repaired {
    inv5[] iff inv5_OK[]
}

pred inv6_OK {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
assert inv6_Repaired {
    inv6[] iff inv6_OK[]
}

pred inv7_OK {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
assert inv7_Repaired {
    inv7[] iff inv7_OK[]
}

pred inv8_OK {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
assert inv8_Repaired {
    inv8[] iff inv8_OK[]
}

pred inv9_OK {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
assert inv9_Repaired {
    inv9[] iff inv9_OK[]
}

pred inv10_OK {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
assert inv10_Repaired {
    inv10[] iff inv10_OK[]
}

**Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
sig Person {
    Tutors: set Person,
    Teaches: set Class
}

sig Group {}

sig Class {
    Groups: Person lone->Group
}

sig Teacher extends Person {}

sig Student extends Person {}

pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}

pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}

pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}

pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}

pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}

pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}

pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}

pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone c.Groups & Teacher
}

pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}

pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}

pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}

pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}

pred inv14 {
    all s: Student, c: Class, g: Group | some t: Teacher | t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}

pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}

pred inv14_OK {
    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}

assert inv14_Repaired {
    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}

check inv14_Repaired expect 0
```

Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\n    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are Class, g: Group | some t: Teacher | some Teacher\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\n    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/* IFF PERFECT ORACLE */\npred inv1_OK {\n    Person in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\n    inv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\npred inv2_OK {\n    no Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\n    inv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\npred inv3_OK {\n    no Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\n    inv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\npred inv4_OK {\n    Person in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\n    inv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\npred inv5_OK {\n    some Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\n    inv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\npred inv6_OK {\n    Teacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\n    inv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\npred inv7_OK {\n    Class in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\n    inv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\npred inv8_OK {\n    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\n    inv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\npred inv9_OK {\n    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\n    inv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\npred inv10_OK {\n    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\n    inv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\npred inv11_OK {\n    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\n    inv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\npred inv12_OK {\n    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\n    inv12[] iff inv12_OK[]\n}\npred inv13_OK {\n    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\nassert inv13_Repaired {\n    inv13[] iff inv13_OK[]\n}\npred inv14_OK {\n    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\n    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\npred inv15_OK {\n    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\n    inv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n-\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv3_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv4_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv5_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv6_Repaired expect ```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Student, c : Class, t : Teacher | ((some g : Group | c->s->g in Groups) and t->c in Teaches) implies t->s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n-\n-- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s : Student | some s.(Class.Groups) and some Teacher.Teaches implies some (Teacher<:Tutors).s\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\ninv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\nno Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\ninv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\ninv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\ninv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\ninv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\ninv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\ninv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\ninv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\ninv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\ninv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired {\ninv11[] iff inv11_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv12_OK {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\nassert inv12_Repaired {\ninv12[] iff Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\ninv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\ninv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n-\n-- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck {
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */\nsig Person  {\n/* Each person tutors a set of persons. */\nTutors : set Person,\n/* Each person teaches a set of classes. */\nTeaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n/* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\nGroups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\nClass in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred inv8 {\nall t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\n/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */\npred inv9 {\nall c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\n/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\nall c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s:Student,c:Class,g:Group|some t:Teacher | some c.Groups\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in >>> Starting Agent SpecificationRepairTask (2) OpenAIChatModel.GPT3_5_TURBO 
**Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person {
    /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
    Tutors: set Person,
    /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
    Teaches: set Class
}
/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}
/* The registered classes. */
sig Class {
    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
    Groups: Person -> Group
}
/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person {}
/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person {}
/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}
/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}
/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}
/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}
/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {
    all x: Person, y: Class, v: Teacher | (some z: Group | y->x->z in Groups) and v->y in Teaches
}
/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}
/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/
pred inv1_OK {
    Person in Student
}
assert inv1_Repaired {
    inv1[] iff inv1_OK[]
}
---------
pred inv2_OK {
    no Teacher
}
assert inv2_Repaired {
    inv2[] iff inv2_OK[]
}
--------
pred inv3_OK {
    no Student & Teacher
}
assert inv3_Repaired {
    inv3[] iff inv3_OK[]
}
--------
pred inv4_OK {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
assert inv4_Repaired {
    inv4[] iff inv4_OK[]
}
--------
pred inv5_OK {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
assert inv5_Repaired {
    inv5[] iff inv5_OK[]
}
--------
pred inv6_OK {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
assert inv6_Repaired {
    inv6[] iff inv6_OK[]
}
--------
pred inv7_OK {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
assert inv7_Repaired {
    inv7[] iff inv7_OK[]
}
--------
pred inv8_OK {
    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
assert inv8_Repaired {
    inv8[] iff inv8_OK[]
}
--------
pred inv9_OK {
    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
assert inv9_Repaired {
    inv9[] iff inv9_OK[]
}
--------
pred inv10_OK {
    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
assert inv10_Repaired {
    inv10[] iff inv10_OK[]
}

    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}

    inv13[] iff inv13_OK[]
}

    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors

    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}

assigned. */\npred inv6 {\n    Teacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\n    Class in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\n    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\n    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\n    all t: Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\n    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\n    all x: Person, y: Class, v: Teacher | (some z: Group | y->x->z in Groups) and v->y in Teaches\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\n    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\n/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\n    Person in Student\n}\nassert inv1_Repaired {\n    inv1[] iff inv1_OK[]\n}\n---------\npred inv2_OK {\n    no Teacher\n}\nassert inv2_Repaired {\n    inv2[] iff inv2_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv3_OK {\n    no Student & Teacher\n}\nassert inv3_Repaired {\n    inv3[] iff inv3_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv4_OK {\n    Person in (Student + Teacher)\n}\nassert inv4_Repaired {\n    inv4[] iff inv4_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv5_OK {\n    some Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv5_Repaired {\n    inv5[] iff inv5_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv6_OK {\n    Teacher in Teaches.Class\n}\nassert inv6_Repaired {\n    inv6[] iff inv6_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv7_OK {\n    Class in Teacher.Teaches\n}\nassert inv7_Repaired {\n    inv7[] iff inv7_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv8_OK {\n    all t: Teacher | lone t.Teaches\n}\nassert inv8_Repaired {\n    inv8[] iff inv8_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv9_OK {\n    all c: Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher\n}\nassert inv9_Repaired {\n    inv9[] iff inv9_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv10_OK {\n    all c: Class, s: Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\nassert inv10_Repaired {\n    inv10[] iff inv10_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv11_OK {\n    all c: Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\nassert inv11_Repaired Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\nassert inv13_Repaired {\n    inv13[] iff inv13_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv14_OK {\n    all s: Person, c: Class, t: Person, g: Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors\n}\nassert inv14_Repaired {\n    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]\n}\n--------\npred inv15_OK {\n    all s: Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}\nassert inv15_Repaired {\n    inv15[] iff inv15_OK[]\n}\n--------\n-\n-- PerfectOracleCommands\ncheck inv1_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv2_Repaired expect 0\ncheck inv3_Repaired expect | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\nall c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\nall t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\nTutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\n\nall x : Person, y : Class, v : Teacher | (some z : Group | y->x->z in persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\nPerson in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\nno Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\nno Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\nPerson in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\nsome Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\nTeacher in classroom_inv14_143.als
>>> Starting Agent SpecificationRepairTask (2) OpenAIChatModel.GPT3_5_TURBO 
**Trial 1:**

**Fixed Specifications:** 
```alloy
/* The registered persons. */
sig Person  {
    /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */
    Tutors : set Person,
    /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */
    Teaches : set Class
}
/* The registered groups. */
sig Group {}
/* The registered classes. */
sig Class  {
    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */
    Groups : Person -> Group
}
/* Some persons are teachers. */
sig Teacher extends Person  {}
/* Some persons are students. */
sig Student extends Person  {}
/* Every person is a student. */
pred inv1 {
    Person in Student
}
/* There are no teachers. */
pred inv2 {
    no Teacher
}
/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */
pred inv3 {
    no Student & Teacher
}
/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */
pred inv4 {
    Person in (Student + Teacher)
}
/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */
pred inv5 {
    some Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */
pred inv6 {
    Teacher in Teaches.Class
}
/* Every class has teachers assigned. */
pred inv7 {
    Class in Teacher.Teaches
}
/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */
pred inv8 {
    all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches
}
/* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */
pred inv9 {
    all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher
}
/* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */
pred inv10 {
    all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */
pred inv11 {
    all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c
}
/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */
pred inv12 {
    all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups
}
/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */
pred inv13 {
    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student
}
/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers
* assigned to that class. */
pred inv14 {
    all s:Student,c:Class,g:Group|some t:Teacher | some s.(c.Groups)
}
/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */
pred inv15 {
    all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s
}

/* IFF PERFECT ORACLE */
pred inv14_OK {
    all s : Person, c : Class, t : Person, g : Group | (c -> s -> g in Groups) and t -> c in Teaches implies t -> s in Tutors
}
assert inv14_Repaired {
    inv14[] iff inv14_OK[]
}
```

**Tool Request:**
```json

Teaches : set Class\n}\n/* The registered groups. */\nsig Group {}\n/* The registered classes. */\nsig Class  {\n    /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */\n    Groups : Person -> Group\n}\n/* Some persons are teachers. */\nsig Teacher extends Person  {}\n/* Some persons are students. */\nsig Student extends Person  {}\n/* Every person is a student. */\npred inv1 {\n    Person in Student\n}\n/* There are no teachers. */\npred inv2 {\n    no Teacher\n}\n/* No person is both a student and a teacher. */\npred inv3 {\n    no Student & Teacher\n}\n/* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */\npred inv4 {\n    Person in (Student + Teacher)\n}\n/* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */\npred inv5 {\n    some Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Every teacher has classes assigned. */\npred inv6 {\n    Teacher in Teaches.Class\n}\n/* Every class has teachers assigned. */\npred inv7 {\n    Class in Teacher.Teaches\n}\n/* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */\npred group assigned. */\npred inv10 {\n    all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */\npred inv11 {\n    all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c\n}\n/* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */\npred inv12 {\n    all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups\n}\n/* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */\npred inv13 {\n    Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 }

Student\n}\n/* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers\n* assigned to that class. */\npred inv14 {\nall s:Student,c:Class,g:Group|some t:Teacher | some s.(c.Groups)\n}\n/* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */\npred inv15 {\nall s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s\n}/*======== IFF PERFECT ORACLE ===============*/\npred inv1_OK {\nPerson in {
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */ sig Person { /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */ Tutors : set Person, /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */ Teaches : set Class } /* The registered groups. */ sig Group {} /* The registered classes. */ sig Class { /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */ Groups : Person -> Group } /* Some persons are teachers. */ no Teacher } /* No person is both a student and a teacher. */ pred inv3 { no Student & Teacher } /* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */ pred inv4 { Person in (Student + Teacher) } /* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */ pred inv5 { some Teacher.Teaches } /* Every teacher has classes assigned. */ pred inv6 { Teacher in Teaches.Class } /* Every class has teachers assigned. */ pred inv7 { Class in Teacher.Teaches } /* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */ pred inv8 { all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches } /* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */ pred inv9 { all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher } /* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */ pred inv10 { all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups) } /* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */ pred inv11 { all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c } /* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */ pred inv12 { all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups } /* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */ pred inv13 { Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student } /* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers * assigned to that class. */ pred inv14 { all s:Student,t:Teacher,c:Class,g:Group | (t->s in Tutors and c->s->g in Groups) implies t->c in Teaches } /* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */ pred inv15 { all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s }"

```json
{
    "request": "run_alloy_analyzer",
    "specification": "/* The registered persons. */ sig Person { /* Each person tutors a set of persons. */ Tutors : set Person, /* Each person teaches a set of classes. */ Teaches : set Class } /* The registered groups. */ sig Group {} /* The registered classes. */ sig Class { /* Each class has a set of persons assigned to a group. */ Groups : Person -> Group } /* Some persons are teachers. */ sig Teacher extends Person {} /* Some persons are students. */ sig Student extends Person {} /* Every person is a student. */ pred inv1 { Person in Student } /* There are no teachers. */ pred inv2 { no Teacher } /* No person is both a student and a teacher. */ pred inv3 { no Student & Teacher } /* No person is neither a student nor a teacher. */ pred inv4 { Person in (Student + Teacher) } /* There are some classes assigned to teachers. */ pred inv5 { some Teacher.Teaches } /* Every teacher has classes assigned. */ pred inv6 { Teacher in Teaches.Class } /* Every class has teachers assigned. */ pred inv7 { Class in Teacher.Teaches } /* Teachers are assigned at most one class. */ pred inv8 { all t:Teacher | lone t.Teaches } /* No class has more than a teacher assigned. */ pred inv9 { all c:Class | lone Teaches.c & Teacher } /* For every class, every student has a group assigned. */ pred inv10 { all c:Class, s:Student | some s.(c.Groups) } /* A class only has groups if it has a teacher assigned. */ pred inv11 { all c : Class | (some c.Groups) implies some Teacher & Teaches.c } /* Each teacher is responsible for some groups. */ pred inv12 { all t : Teacher | some (t.Teaches).Groups } /* Only teachers tutor, and only students are tutored. */ pred inv13 { Tutors.Person in Teacher and Person.Tutors in Student } /* Every student in a class is at least tutored by all the teachers * assigned to that class. */ pred inv14 { all s:Student,t:Teacher,c:Class,g:Group | (t->s in Tutors and c->s->g in Groups) implies t->c in Teaches } /* The tutoring chain of every person eventually reaches a Teacher. */ pred inv15 { all s : Person | some Teacher & ^Tutors.s }"
